meanings.definition: Quixotism: behavior inspired by Don Quixote, characterized by lofty and romantic ideals
meanings.sent1: Her quixotism led her to believe in the power of love to conquer all obstacles.
meanings.sent2: His quixotism often made him see the world through rose-colored glasses.
meanings.sent3: Despite his quixotism, she found his romantic gestures endearing.
meanings.sent4: In a world of practicality, his quixotism shone like a beacon of hope.
meanings.sent5: The quixotism of the young couple's love story captured the hearts of many.

meanings.definition: Quixotism: impracticality or extravagance in pursuit of ideals
meanings.sent1: The businessman's quixotism in investing all his savings in a risky venture left him bankrupt.
meanings.sent2: Her quixotism in trying to change the world overnight often led to disappointment.
meanings.sent3: Despite the quixotism of his plan, he remained determined to make it a reality.
meanings.sent4: His quixotism in believing he could single-handedly solve world hunger was both admirable and naive.
meanings.sent5: The quixotism of her dreams was as vast and unreachable as the stars in the sky.
